LITERATURE REVIEW ON


INSTANT CRIME REPORTOR AND


WANTED CRIMINAL FINDER



1.1, INTRODUCTION


Crime is the main concern the world need to tackle, and is true for


Ethiopia. The occurrence of crime is rising high - properties are being


robbed, tourists and passengers are hanged always, in addition


pickpocketing, purse snatching are common. People needs to combat


these crimes as fast as possible.so my objective is to create an opportunity


for our people to instantly report crimes and help investigators find


criminals in short time using the IT infrastructure we have today.


Number of smart phone users, computer users and telecommunication


services are rising fast due to this information is distributed from every


corner of the country. Hence, can we use the current Ethiopian IT


infrastructure to achieve crime reporter and criminal finder?




1.2, Role of Citizen in Combating Crime


To encourage the public to help protect children and young people by


reporting any concerns of abuse or neglect, the Department for Education


has launched the “Together, we can tackle child abuse campaign” (1) In


England. This ensures the trust of the government on the people to


combat crime. The same is true in our country, the government believe


that the people is the “owner and holder of peace” [2].


1.3, Role of IT in Reporting and Finding Criminals/Related jobs


In countries like England, an online crime reporting facility has been


developed so that you can report hate crimes online, if you do not want to


report directly to the police. The police take hate crime very seriously


and will record and investigate this offence even if you do not want to give


your details [1].


Most people don’t report crime due to the overhead they may face, due


to that crimes are rising high. The United Kingdom Police Administration


provides “an anonymous way of reporting crime through online for those


people who don’t want to reveal themselves” [1].


But, the above mentioned institutions don’t provide any mechanism to


find wanted criminals other than reporting. That is their limitation.


1.4, Conclusion


Most crimes need urgent response by their nature, but the current


Ethiopian criminal reporting mechanism cannot achieve that urgency.


Therefore, due to delay lives of hundreds may be lost. This is a headache


for the citizen. In addition, people are not able to report complains in an


anonymous way.so our system is expected to solve these problems.


Therefore, the main target of this project is to fill the gap seen in crime


reporting and finding criminal in Ethiopia by coupling both crime


reporting and criminal finding. That makes this project to be dual


purpose than the others built before.
